intro: Fleischmannia haughtii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a tall, flowering stem that emerges from the center of the rosette. Fleischmannia haughtii is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
